newsitem.title: USA: US Filter says court rules against Culligan.
newsitem.headline: US Filter says court rules against Culligan.

text.p: United States Filter Corp said Wednesday that a court ruling has cleared the way for it to proceed with the acquisition of United States Water Co later this month.
U.S. Filter said the Chancery Court of Cook County, Ill. granted summary judgment in an action brought by Culligan International Co seeking to stop the acquisition.
Culligan International is a unit of Culligan Water Technologies Inc.

U.S. Filter said the court found that Culligan does not have a right of first refusal to purchase the business of U.S. Water and that U.S. Water properly terminated all of its Culligan franchise agreements.

"While we are disappointed by the action taken by the court, we do not believe it will have a material effect on Culligan or its business," said Ed Christensen, vice president and general counsel of Culligan Water Technologies.
He said Culligan will appeal the ruling.
